titleStmt.title: Receipt issued by the defensor of Antaeopolis

msContents.summary: The defensor of Antaeopolis, Fl. Paulus, issues a receipt to the protocometae of the village of Aphrodito for one solidus, minus 2 carats, which is intended for the ordinarius

msItem.note: 6 lines against the fibers; possible traces of 1 line along the fibers on the back
German translation on pp. 146-147 of ed.pr.
Belongs to Dioscorus archive and involves same Paulus as P.Ross.Georg. III 34

provenance.p: From the collection of N. Likhachov; once housed in the Paleographical Museum of the Academy of Science in St. Petersburg; now in the Hermitage Museum

div.ab: I, Flavius Paulus, defensor of Antaeopolis, to the most admirable protocometae of the village of Aphrodito. I have taken and been paid in full by you one solidus, minus 2 carats, given according to custom by the goldsmith's standard to the honorable ordinarius, on account of his help to me, from my synetheiai for the canon of the second indiction. And I have given as surety to you this receipt, as set out above. Flavius Paulos, the defensor mentioned above; I agree with the receipt, as set out above.

listBibl.bibl: P.Ross.Georg. III 35 See "Addenda et corrigenda," p. 295f.
